대사: @Who is this^ Fab. The great detective of Arkham! What are you doing in this dingy place?@
@ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ... you're still the same as you've been in a long time.@
@My only strength. Sit down.@
@You do realize it's crackdown soon^ right?@
@ⓖ(Albert)ⓦ will handle it. Besides^ even if they get caught^ it would be more like doing community service.@
(ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ smirked and brought me a drink.)
@I envy you for that^ don't you?@
@Haha...@
@So what are you doing here? Business as usual@
@I caught one of the big ones. But it's complicated.@
@Come when you're not working. You're a bitch.@
@If i can afford it. So^ ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ^ what about you^ how are things going?@
@It's business as usual for us^ all the bigwigs are off to the beach.@
@I don't know when our ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ will be like that..~@
@You'll see.@
@Haha... By the way^ it's quiet here today.@
@Because of crack down. Today^ it's just those two customers over there.@
@I heard that they were a ⓖ(●2ⓦsewer worker)ⓦ and got unfairly dismissed? It's a sad situation in this kind of world these days.@
@They must have needed a drink.@
(ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ and I joked about it for a while.)☆①
@Who is this^ Fab. The great detective of Arkham! What are you doing in this dingy place?@
@ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ... you're still the same as you've been in a long time.@
@My only strength. Sit down.@
@You do realize it's crackdown soon^ right?@
@ⓖ(Albert)ⓦ will handle it. Besides^ even if they get caught^ it would be more like doing community service.@
(ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ smirked and brought me a drink.)
@I envy you for that^ don't you?@
@Haha...@
@So what are you doing here? Business as usual@
@No^ I don't have a request these days^ and the one I did have I skipped because it seemed too risky.@
@So^ ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ^ what about you^ how are things going?@
@It's business as usual for us^ all the bigwigs are off to the beach.@
@I don't know when our ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ will be like that..~@
@You'll see.@
@Haha... By the way^ it's quiet here today.@
@Because of crack down. Today^ it's just those two customers over there.@
@I heard that they were a ⓖ(●2ⓦsewer worker)ⓦ and got unfairly dismissed? It's a sad situation in this kind of world these days.@
@They must have needed a drink.@
(ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ and I joked about it for a while.)☆①
(ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ^ a mafia and bartender^ is cleaning the glasses.)
@Why^ do you have a question?@☆①
@Have you ever heard of a ⓡ(planetary march)ⓦ?@
@I saw that in the paper the other day. You don't really believe what you read there^ do you?@
@No way. I'd rather believe you when you say you're going to make it and find a job for me.@
(ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ glares at me.)
@I heard there's a stargazing show at ⓑ(Miskatonic University)ⓦ. Would you like to come? I haven't seen ⓖ(Albert)ⓦ's face in a while.@
@It's been a while since the three of us got together.@
@Hmmm... maybe.@
@ⓖ(●2ⓜPromise)ⓦ! I'll come out to the ⓑ(university)ⓦ on the evening of the 15th. Let ⓖ(Albert)ⓦ know later as well.@
@Isn't it because the government banned alcohol.@
@If we can't sleep^ we should just punch a drink and lie down.@
@Is that so...?@
@I don't know how he's doing. It's hard to see him in these times.@
@At least he's the most trouble-free of the three of us.@
@That may be true^ but it feels somewhat precarious from my perspective.@
@Because it's him^ as long as there are no problems with women^ wouldn't that be enough?@
(I lowered my voice so only ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ could hear me.)
@Have you heard about the recent spate of ⓡ(people going missing)ⓦ?@
@Missing people? No^ I've never heard of it.@
@So at least it wasn't you guys.@
@Look^ these days we also earn our living honestly through business@
@...Some people need to be 'kick his ass' once in a while^ but not continuously^ and not for the general public.@
@ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ^ you know what I saw today in the sewers by the river? A man with eyes the size of fists.@
column4: 하수도의 섬뜩한눈1 - Saw in the sewer

대사: @You're not... you're not sneaking drugs or something?@
(She doesn't seem to believe me.)
@The characteristic ⓡ(fishy smell)ⓦ... Isn't that them over there?@
@What^ the ⓖ(●3ⓦsewer worker)ⓦ from earlier?@
@I don't know^ but it smells horribly fishy. Go smell it.@
@They do smell awful in there. I can understand the suspicion.@@
@Have you ever heard of ⓖ(Aiden Triss)ⓦ? He's a Journalist for the ⓑ(Daily News)ⓦ over there.@
@Journalist Tris? I know^ because my henchman put a bullet in her shoulder.@
@Uh?? Really?@
@Yeah^ it was a couple months ago^ but he's been taking pictures in our territory and doing interviews.@
@I gave him a kick in the pants to let him know I'd 'kick his ass' if he bothered me too much.@
'It's a small world.'
@Wh.. who are you^ w..why? What's going on...@
(The man sitting across from he looks at me with a rough look and says)
@We're in a very bad mood right now because we just got fired...@
@Go away.@☆①
(It doesn't even react.)☆①
(Two men who appear to be ⓖ(sewer workers)ⓦ are sitting and drinking.)
(They're already blushing^ as if they are had quite a bit to drink).
'What a smell..!'
(Upon examination^ their bodies emit a ⓡ(fishy smell)ⓦ unlike anything i've ever smelled before.)
(Two men who appear to be ⓖ(sewer workers)ⓦ are sitting and drinking.)
(They're already blushing^ as if they are had quite a bit to drink).
'What a smell..!'
(Upon examination^ their bodies emit a ⓡ(fishy smell)ⓦ unlike anything i've ever smelled before.)
'It seems that the source of the city's ⓡ(●3ⓕfishy smells)ⓦ has something to do with these people.
@I'm not sure about that.@
@Have you heard about the water and ocean-related ⓡ(nightmares)ⓦ spreading among people lately?@
@What^ have they found a drug that does that?@
@Well^ anyway^ the ⓑ(hospital)ⓦ is getting a lot of patients.@
@Water^ the ocean.... I have no idea. Maybe they're having a collective mental breakdown.@
@Maybe it's because they're not drinking^ like you said.@
(ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ smirked at my comment.)
@Have you heard the ⓡ(ghost story)ⓦ about alligators living in the ⓑ(sewers)ⓦ?@
@I know^ I know. A lot of people who come in ask.@
@I don't know who put it out ^ but I want to beat the crap out of them.@
@Judging by the reaction^ it's a total rumor^ right?@
@Not at all^ I can say this because I've been using the ⓑ(sewer)ⓦ smuggling route all along. .@
@It's blocked now because of the police investigation.@
@I see.@
@It's a problem^ I mean^ how much money did I spend on that smuggling route!@
@Because of that I had to dig up a new smuggling route on Innsmouth.@
@Innsmouth? That little coastal town?@
@Yeah... I spent a lot of money because they were so closed@
@I've heard rumors that they're vicious^ so be careful.@
@Have you heared that the water in ⓑ(river)ⓦ has been strangely clear lately?@
@No^ not at all?@
@I hear it's now drinkable.@
@Hmm. The prohibition law flushed all that booze down the drain^ so maybe that disinfected it?@
@Alcohol can disinfect.@
@Ugh^ that's so you.@
(I walked into the ⓑ(bar)ⓦ and a few men were handing ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ a box of something.)
'Is that a...?'
(While I was staring at them^ I smelled a ⓡ(fishy smell)ⓦ as they walked by.)
'This smells like...'
'I think it's the ⓡ(fishy smell)ⓦ that's been going around lately...'※②
column4: // 화면 암전 이후 Maeve 앞으로 이동

'Are they fishermen or something? That stinks.'※②
column4: // 화면 암전 이후 Maeve 앞으로 이동

대사: @Hey^ Fabian. I've been seeing you a lot lately.@
@Somehow^ What about those people?@
@These are the people we've been helped lately^ new suppliers and buyers.@
@Supplier and buyer? What does that mean?@
@Recently^ the smuggling route was blocked.@
@So we've been getting our booze from the Innsmouth side. New bootlegging route.@
@They're making algae-based liquor. It's like a specialty.@
@So I'm bringing in that alcohol as well.@
@Lately^ we've had a few people from Innsmouth come in to buy the seaweed liquor.@
@We're happy to have a new root^ they're happy to get a taste of home. Two birds with one stone.@
@Heh... that's great^ yeah. Why don't you give me a that drink?@
@Hmm... Unfortunately^ that's going to be tough^ Fab.@
@They made me promise^ Don't sell this to anyone else.@
@If we're going to work on this^ shouldn't we at least not betray our fellow man?@
@Well^ if that's the case^ so be it...@
@Other than that^ let them order anything.@
(With that^ ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ lifted her glass and began to polish it.)※①

@Well^ if that's the case^ so be it...@
@Other than that^ let them order anything.@
(With that^ ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ lifted her glass and began to polish it.)※①
@Have you heard the ⓑ(sewer)ⓦ story lately?@
@ⓑ(sewer)ⓦ? Um... I don't know. My smuggling route is clogged and I'm not paying attention.@
@A few months ago^ I would have known^ but now I have no idea.@
@You know what? There was a ⓡ(murder)ⓦ in broad daylight in a family home today...@

대사: @I've heard that too.@
@I'll tell you in advance^ not ours..@
@I have a malice against ⓖ(Aiden)ⓦ^ but not enough to kill him.@
@Because what we're doing is more important...@
@I understand that. Have you heard anything else about that?@
@Well... my kids haven't heard much about it yet either.@
@According to ⓡ(witnesses)ⓦ of the day's ⓡ(murder)ⓦ^ the suspect was wearing a ⓡ(workman's outfit)ⓦ.@
column4: 키워드 살인사건 - 목격자 증언 (집밖 듣기판정 성공)>>

대사: @Workman's outfit? What does it look like.@
(I described what I heard in as much detail as I could.)
@Uh^ I think that was ⓡ(●1ⓩsewer workers' outfit)ⓦ.@
@I remember a few of their guys came over for drinks recently.@
@ⓖ(Sewer worker)ⓦ? So you're saying the case was done by them?@
@I don't know why ⓑ(●1ⓢsewerge office)ⓦ people do that^ but I think so.@
@The ⓡ(fishy smell)ⓦ^ ⓡ(disappearances)ⓦ^ and the ⓡ(murders)ⓦ all seem to be connected.@
column4: 키워드 살인사건 -실종사건과 비릿한 냄새 (시체 살펴보기)>> <<비릿한냄새 - 소스 스페큘레이션이 없다면>>

대사: @ⓖ(Aiden)ⓦ was also ⓡ(missing)ⓦ and ⓖ(Ella)ⓦ's body there smelled ⓡ(fishy)ⓦ.@
@What if the ⓡ(murder)ⓦ was the result of a mistake on the part of the ⓡ(culprit)ⓦ^ who was originally responsible for the ⓡ(disappearance)ⓦ?@
@ⓡ(fishy smell)ⓦ... then maybe it has something to do with ⓖ(sewer worker)ⓦ.@
@Huh? Really?@
@The ⓖ(sewer workers)ⓦ who came by yesterday had that characteristic ⓡ(fishy smell)ⓦ^ so probably right.@
@Maeve^ about that drink...@
(I somehow convinced her to let me take a sip.)
@You are a handful... Okay^ okay.@
@Let's see...@
(I started to feel fuzzy-headed as the alcohol hit my mouth.)
(And when I opened my eyes again^ I suddenly started choking.)
'What... what..!?'
(I panic and try to breathe through my mouth^ but I still get a burning sensation in my throat.)
(What I see in my blurry vision is something green.)
(I gasped^ startled by the intense salt rush down my throat.)※③
@Hey^ wake up! What's wrong with you?@
(ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ's words caught me off guard^ and I realized that I was gasping for air with my head down.)
@It.. It's not a big deal. It's a terrible drink... yeah.@
@Ugh... I told you not to drink it.@
@That's a horrible experience.  Those Innsmouth people... How do they drink this?@
(Afterward^ I got another drink to cheer myself up.)
(I didn't convince ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ in the end.)
